question: Which two water bodies form the coastline of Estonia?
option1: Baltic Sea and Gulf of Bothnia
option2: Baltic Sea and Gulf of Finland
option3: Black Sea and Gulf of Bothnia
option4: Black Sea and Gulf of Finland
answer: Baltic Sea and Gulf of Finland
explanation: Estonia, officially known as the Republic of Estonia, is a country located on the eastern coast of Baltic Sea in the Northern Europe, sharing land borders with only two countries such as Russia to the east and Latvia to the south. Baltic Sea and the Gulf of Finland form the coastline of Estonia to the west and north respectively. The Gulf of Finland, the easternmost arm of the Baltic Sea, lies to the north and across between Estonia and Finland, in which Russia, Finland and Estonia form the basin countries of the Gulf of Finland. Baltic Sea lies to the west and across between Estonia and Sweden. The capital of Estonia is Tallinn, which is Estoniaâ€™s financial, industrial and cultural centre. The parliament name of Estonia is Riigikogu, which is a unicameral parliament. Lake Peipus, which is the largest transboundary lake and fifth-largest lake in Europe, located on the border between Estonia and Russia. The currency of Estonia is Euro.
